content.raw:
Your comments are good, and I have started writing code to address them, but adding that code to this pull request would move it away from the spirit of refactoring that this pull request started with. So if you don't mind I'll fix these in my next friction pull request.

EDIT: added a note in #989 reminding me to do this.
content.html:
Your comments are good, and I have started writing code to address them, but adding that code to this pull request would move it away from the spirit of refactoring that this pull request started with. So if you don't mind I'll fix these in my next friction pull request.

EDIT: added a note in #989 reminding me to do this.

content.raw:
The assert is only executed when in debug mode. This program will segfault in the normal case if _sdf is NULL. The asserts should be replaced with `if` statements and `gzerr` messages. 

There are multiple occurrences of the same behavior below.
content.html:
The assert is only executed when in debug mode. This program will segfault in the normal case if _sdf is NULL. The asserts should be replaced with if statements and gzerr messages.

There are multiple occurrences of the same behavior below.

content.raw: Yes, the INTEGRATION_physics_friction is a good test for this. Since pull request #885 was recently merged, it is now included in this branch. I made a few changes in 9ff5c83 to account for the refactoring of SurfaceParams.
content.html: Yes, the INTEGRATION_physics_friction is a good test for this. Since pull request #885 was recently merged, it is now included in this branch. I made a few changes in 9ff5c83 to account for the refactoring of SurfaceParams.
